intro: Aster wimmeri, commonly known as the Wimmer's aster, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Its ornamental value and adaptability make it a popular choice among gardeners seeking drought-tolerant plants.
